alert.note: Alert for Northern Washington; Southern Washington (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 2:01PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Washington County through 230 PM EDT... At 201 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hartford, or 11 miles south of Whitehall, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Granville, Hartford, Comstock, Porter, Middle Granville, Slateville, Braymer School, East Hartford, Adamsville, North Granville, Slyboro, Belcher, East Hebron, South Granville, South Hartford, Truthville, Raceville, West Granville and North Hebron. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
